contents.contents: A license is allowed if Fedora determines that the license is a free software / open source license. At a high level, the inquiry involves determining whether the license provides software freedom, and (equivalently) making sure that the license does not place burdens on users' exercise of its permissions that are inconsistent with evolving community norms and traditions around what is acceptable in a free software / open source license. See below for more on the history of Fedora licensing policy.

These licenses lack important but nonessential elements of permissive open software licenses or impose additional requirements or restrictions, such as BSD-style prohibitions against endorsement and promotion.

contents: These licenses lack important but nonessential elements of permissive open software licenses or impose additional requirements or restrictions, such as BSD-style prohibitions against endorsement and promotion.

contents.contents: MIT with no false attribution License

contents:
Per Fedora, this license is based on the MIT license, but contains an
additional section covering the removal of attributions in certain
modification scenarios. It is Free and GPL-compatible. Use License MITNFA

contents.contents: Open source license that is made available under "non-copyleft" licenses. These generally require attribution of the included works and may include other obligations.
Whether the license includes a notice obligation or similar which can be fulfilled by adding the relevant copyright notices and the license text into the project/product notice file.
Same as above, as a temporary work-around for the category name not being configurable in ORT reports, see https://github.com/oss-review-toolkit/ort/issues/8220.

This property indicates that the license contains obligations that are triggered by modifying the licensed content. The scope of obligations could vary, but typically it is about somehow making sure that the recipients of the modified content don't attribute the modifications to the wrong author and/or that the unmodified content is available to the recipients. The obligations go beoynd of mere marking of the modifications. Artistic-type licenses have this property, but also some others.

_olcCategories.description: Open source license that is made available under "non-copyleft" licenses. These generally require attribution of the included works and may include other obligations.
_olcCategories.name: permissive

_olcCategories.description: Whether the license includes a notice obligation or similar which can be fulfilled by adding the relevant copyright notices and the license text into the project/product notice file.
_olcCategories.name: property:include-in-notice-file

_olcCategories.description: Same as above, as a temporary work-around for the category name not being configurable in ORT reports, see https://github.com/oss-review-toolkit/ort/issues/8220.
_olcCategories.name: include-in-notice-file

_olcCategories.description: This property indicates that the license contains obligations that are triggered by modifying the licensed content. The scope of obligations could vary, but typically it is about somehow making sure that the recipients of the modified content don't attribute the modifications to the wrong author and/or that the unmodified content is available to the recipients. The obligations go beoynd of mere marking of the modifications. Artistic-type licenses have this property, but also some others.
_olcCategories.name: property:modification-related-obligations

contents.contents: Eine Lizenz ist freigegeben, wenn sie nach fachlicher und juristischer Prüfung seitens Open CoDE sowohl der Open Source Definition (gemäß Definition der Open Source Initiative [extern]) entspricht und darüber hinaus keine für die Öffentliche Verwaltung erkennbaren Schwierigkeiten birgt. Außer in Ausnahmefällen ist nicht zu erwarten, dass einmal freigegebene Lizenzen deklassifiziert werden.

permissions._str:
Description: Relevant documentation for the software should be treated in the same way as for the software.
Actions:
- Ol Use the obtained source code without modification (Use the fetched code as it is.)
- Ol Modify the obtained source code.
- Ol Using Modified Source Code
- Ol Use the retrieved object code (Use the fetched code as it is.)
- Ol Use the object code generated from the modified source code
- Ol Use the retrieved executable (Use the obtained executable as is.)
- Ol Use the executable generated from the modified source code

Conditions: None

permissions._str:
Description: The relevant documentation for the software will be treated in the same way as the software. The same rights will be granted to those to whom the software is provided.
Actions:
- Ol Distribute the obtained source code without modification (Redistribute the code as it was obtained)
- Ol Distribute the obtained object code (Redistribute the code as it was obtained)
- Ol Sublicense the acquired source code. (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)
- Ol Sublicense the acquired object code (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)
- Ol Selling Software
- Ol Distribute the obtained executable (Redistribute the obtained executable as-is)
- Ol Sublicense the acquired executable (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)

Conditions:
Ol OBLIGATION: Include a copyright notice, list of terms and conditions, and disclaimer included in the license

permissions._str:
Description: The relevant documentation for the software will be treated in the same way as the software. The same rights will be granted to those to whom the software is provided.
Actions:
- Ol Distribution of Modified Source Code
- Ol Distribute the object code generated from the modified source code
- Ol Sublicensing Modified Source Code (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)
- Ol Sublicense the object code generated from the modified source code (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)
- Ol Distribute the executable generated from the modified source code
- Ol Sublicense the generated executable from modified source code (Sublicensing means that the person to whom the license was granted re-grants the license granted to a third party.)

Conditions:
AND
  Ol OBLIGATION: Include a copyright notice, list of terms and conditions, and disclaimer included in the license
  OR
    Ol OBLIGATION: Change the e-mail address or URL of the original author's bug report to the contact information of the organization responsible for the modification.
    Ol OBLIGATION: Delete the e-mail address or URL of the original author's bug report
